meanings.definition: The state or condition of being an imbecile.
meanings.sent1: Her imbecility was evident in her inability to solve simple puzzles.
meanings.sent2: The imbecility of his actions led to disastrous consequences.
meanings.sent3: Despite his imbecility, he always managed to make us laugh with his silly jokes.
meanings.sent4: The imbecility of the situation was like trying to fit a square peg into a round hole.
meanings.sent5: The imbecility of the decision was so clear, it was like a bright red warning sign.

meanings.definition: A foolish or stupid act or idea.
meanings.sent1: The imbecility of his plan was evident from the start.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help but laugh at the sheer imbecility of his suggestion.
meanings.sent3: The imbecility of the situation was so absurd, it was like a scene from a comedy.
meanings.sent4: His imbecility in handling the project was like watching a train wreck in slow motion.
meanings.sent5: The imbecility of their argument was like listening to two toddlers argue over a toy.
